Posts.Title: The prognosis in not good RobinWendy BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 08:16PM GracePang wrote: Hi Candice, You are such a lovely daughter and Hope the whole brain radiation will work for your Mom (I am sure it will). I am in a very similar situation as your Mom. I had mutiple brain tumors found last May (more than a dozen and they didn't give me a count) and I also saw bursting lights. My oncologist gave me the exact same advice/suggestions as your Mom's doctor, which really upset me. He didn't want to switch my drugs (Taxotere+Herceptin) to Xeloda + Tykerb; referred me to a rad onc to take care of my brain and he kept watching for my other mets (liver & lungs). I had WBR last July and the MRI in Sept showed significant decrease of tumor sizes. By December, MRI shows all small tumors were gone, but 3 of them glowed up. I just had Gamma knife two weeks ago and my next MRI was booked to be in April; Hope the Gamma knife will zap them all. I pushed for Xeloda in November and got it along with Herceptin since then. I will see my onc this Friday and will push for Tykerb. Here, if he gives me Tykerb, he will drop Herceptin, which I don't agree, but I know that he would not give me Herceptin and Tykerb at the same time. At least, Tykerb will work on brain tumors, so I would be willing to try. There are many ladies on this board taking Tykerb and Herceptin with good results. If possible, you may want to push for that. You can do a search on this board about brain mets and can find alot of information. Grace

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2009 06:26PM GracePang wrote: Prayers and condolences to the family.
Posts.Title: Luv2Travel is an Angel now LuAnnH BonnieVA

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2009 05:00PM GracePang wrote: Dear All, Thank you for your advice. I spent my whole day at the hospital to talk to my onc and then wait for 6 hours in the ER to get blood thinner shot. Just got home a while ago. Still feel bad. I talked to my onc about all possible options, including using another vein, take herceptin without taxotere, keep the port while take blood thinner and get chemo next week, ect. He would not bend. He insist to deal with the clot first, which apprently was very small and radiologist would not even sure if it was a clot. My onc would not even give me a date for my next chemo, because he said it depends on the blood thinners work. The doctor at the ER contacted my surgeon and ask him if he would remove the port. The surgeon said no as long as my arm does not swallen. So, don't know what I shall do if my onc insist to remove the port. Removing the port will further delay my chemo and as Flash mentioned it could cause more clots. I somehow feel that onc reluctant to give me chemo. My chemo was already delayed because he suggested me to get the port. Now, he insisted on an ultrasound to find out the small clot, which will further delay my chemo. In Canada, we have to have family doctor to refer us to a second opinion, which may take a while. I know it won't matter if chemo was delayed for one or two weeks, but the thing is he would not even give me an approximate date for my next chemo. I feel so helpless. I was so upset with him and he said if I insist keeping the port, I should sign a paper saying that it was my decesion and he will not be responsible anymore. please tell me what I shall do....
Posts.Title: Urgent: Advice Needed for Port clot and canceled chemo GracePang GracePang

Posts.Content: GracePang wrote: I had Port installed last Friday and the nurse drew blood successfully this Tuesday. My onc ordered ultrasound and they now said they suspect there was a small clot near my port. My onc decided cancel my treatment scheduled for tomorrow, to remove the line and give me blood thinner. I am feeling perfectly fine now. Shalll I get a second opinion or shall I insist getting the chemo? The chemo is so important since he only give me 1 year to live with chemo and 6 mths without chemo. I am so upset with his decision. Is there way to get chemo from other vein without the port? Any advice would be appreciated.  ER-/PR-; Her2+++, Stage III breast cancer 5 years ago. Had AC+T and then 1 year of Herceptin. Mets on Liver and Lungs now. Innumerable nodules. They also told m that blood thinner's risk is bleeding and if it happens in brain, it will be a stroke. If I knew ahead of time about these risks of a port, I would not take it. I feel doomed now to complicate the current desease. I would suggest ofther sisters considering a port to be careful. Don't know if you have got similar information about the clot thing.

Anybody has had such experience and can tell me where the dry cough comes from? My cancer mets to lung, liver and bone. Is it possible that the cancer still grow after TC, which got worse that caused coughing?
